Extremely fun game to always turn to with the intense game play of a survivor *with a good killer* to always be looking for another loop to bully the killer around. Giant variety of perks to use for both killer and survivor to use to give an edge to the game. Great game to buy to kill heaps of hours on, also don't be the guy to throw down shack immediately. Do you like boring unbalanced (impossible to balance) gameplay? Do you like pay-to-win? Do you like players who have played the game longer having technical advantages over you simply because they've played longer? (rather than advantages in skill/understanding the game?) Do you like games where everything is locked behind a paywall, despite the initial offerings of the game being extremely shallow? Do you like a game that implemented predatory mechanics to squeeze money out of players who bought the game at release and were misled into thinking the game would receive content updates? (That werent movie tie-in character purchases) Then Dead by Daylight is for you, however, it is not for me!

4人のサバイバーと1人のキラー側に別れて、サバイバーは5台の発電機を起動させ、脱出ゲートを開き
脱出すれば勝利、キラーは4人のサバイバーを誰かひとりでも処刑すれば勝利となる

このゲームにはパークと呼ばれる能力があり、発電機を修理するのが数パーセント早くなる、味方の位置が分かるなど、目的遂行のための手助けをしてくれる要素があり、この組み合わせにより
多くの行動パターンを生み出すことに成功している(修理に専念する構成か、逃げることに特化した構成か…など)

これにより、こういうパターンを試したいと、どんどんプレイする回数が増えていく中毒性がある
これもまたゲームにのめり込ませる技術として見習うべきポイントである

しかし、5年も前のゲームかつ新要素がどんどん追加されるということもあり、現在はパークのバランスやマップのバランスがインフレ気味
初心者には取っ掛かりにくいゲームとなってしまっているのはマイナスポイントである

こういうゲームはいずれインフレを起こす定めではあるが、それでもいまだに遊ばれているということは
このゲームにはそれほどプレイヤーを虜にする魅力があるということである
それを学ぶためにも、ぜひ一度遊んでもらいたい1本である
I have 1k hours, dont do it.

This game is good with simple, special and interesting mechanichs. I would recomend this game to my friends.
But there is a huge minuses in DBD such as:
1) Community - super toxic. like 90% of survivors will t-bag u every game in the moments when they stun u with the pallet or they vault through the window, or they flash u, or t-bag at the exit gates;
2) Unballanced mechanich that give u 100% advantage. Like this survs perks, almost every second or third perk is a second chance or help u without mindgaming or just doing something. U just run and u win. There is no challange in this, u get outplayed by the surv by just shift+w and sometimes lazily pressing space.
Boon totems is unbalanced, running speed is strange, so much cheaters/hackers and etc.

Let me start off with saying this game is really fun. Put it in a vaccum seal without looking at the bugs, balancing issues, *cough* community *cough*, and lack of fucking anti cheat lol, this game is awesome. On paper the idea of Dead by Daylight is so genius. A typical cat and mouse horror game. But obviously there are a lot and I mean A LOT of problems with the game, so much so I can't list them all but I'll list a few. 

1. This game is 100% survivor sided.
 There is literally no argument to be said to defend the shit that survivors are capable of doing. It literally takes simple math to realize that 4 surviors + meta perks + comms + map of their choice due to offerings = a complete unfair match for the killer (obviously there are things the killer can do to prevent/ be somewhat on par with them but thats a different can of worms)
2. Cheating is rampant...at least for now. 
While I don't wanna say they ignore any report that you give out to someone... they literally fucking ignore any and all reports that you will give to a blatant hacker/cheater. There are multiple examples across the internet and community of hackers maintaining their account for long periods of time. People even going the extra mile to submit a support ticket with proof and nothing happening. There is literally no point of reporting someone. Your report goes into a black hole. Anti cheat is non-existent.
3. Map balancing and "Strong Loops"
Map balancing has been an ongoing discussion since the start of the game and I don't think it will stop ever honestly. This kinda ties in with the "survivor sided problem". There are multiple maps and loops in the game that have severe balancing issues. Now granted maps are actually kinda ok nowadays, only issue I can think of is just the sheer size of some of them (Red forest, RPD, Coldwind, Autohaven, Macmillan, Haddonfield, etc.). When it comes to some pallets the survivors have, there are plenty of pallets that the killer is literally forced to break in order to maintain pursuit or destroy a strong pallet so survivors can't keep coming back to it. There are some loops that are so strong that literally bloodlusting is the only way to get a hit with some killers and against a smart survivor.
4. Bugs
This game is filled with bugs. Go figure. 
5. The "Grind"
The grind in this game is by far one of the most time inducing ones I've ever had the displeasure of experiencing. Currently as of December 12, 2021, there are 26 killers and 29 survivors and this number will continue to grow for the foreseeable future. In this game, getting every killer and survivor to the max level of level 50 will take fucking forever.  Getting bloodpoints is so tedious that you have to heavily rely on free bp codes, Extra bloodpoint offerings, Daily Rituals, Archive challenges, events, the occasional bloodhunt (2x bloodpoints) etc. The max bloodpoints that you can get in a match of DBD without any external boosters that im aware of is 32,000, and this is if you're playing the match to its maximum potential. People who know this game that 32,000 bloodpoints is practically nothing, you might get one level for a character, possible two if you buy the cheapest items in the bloodweb. I'm not even mentioning the fact that there's 3 tiers of perks and prestiges which rewards you with a bloody cosmetic and a higher chance of getting "rarer" items in the bloodweb, which is such a shit incentive to prestige a character.

Now that I listed problems with the game, let me list the great things about this game.

1. Survive with Friends.
Survive with Friends or "SWF" is a pretty heated debate among the community. But I'm not gonna talk about the bad. Playing survivor with friends is so much fun. Solo q'ing in this game can be a fucking nightmare, so playing with friends is a huge breath of fresh air. Open communication and just chilling with your buds is such a good feature in this game.
2. Licenses 
Correct me if I'm wrong, this game is the only game in the world with multiple iconic horror icons and video game characters that you can play as. From Michael Myers to fucking Leon Scott Kennedy. There are so many licensed characters in this game which make it that much more cool depending on your stance.
3. Quality of Life Fixes
Now as much shit BHVR gets (rightfully so lol), when they do quality of life fixes, they make the game so much better. Perk changes, game mechanics, the dreaded key item, better quality, literally anything that makes the game feel and flow smoother is done superb... most of the time.
4. Game Design
BHVR deserves all the props when it comes to the Characters and look of the game. They truly all do look amazing. Almost every character has their own personality and flair that makes it feel super personal. Killer design is fucking amazing, the blight, trickster, sprit, ghostface, demogorgon, being my favorites when it comes to design. The maps all look great. Every map has its own atmosphere that it try's to push out and I can say with confidence that they do it very well.
5. Lore
The lore in this game is immense and really thought out. The Archive really does a great way of showing you lore at the cost of playing the game. Killer backstory's are phenomenal as well as survivors. They continue on with the archives as well. Maps have lore, killers weapons have lore, cosmetics have lore, even perk descriptions have fucking lore.

Would I recommend this game? Personally, Yes. I absolutely love this game and is a blast too play whenever it works and isn't a broken piece of shit. I highly recommend playing this with friends thought because it makes the game so much more fun than solo q-ing as survivor or killer. The community is awesome (most of the time). The well known content creators of the community are all really wholesome and welcoming to new players. Otzdarva is a great person to watch if you're new to the game.

As much as I want to recommend this game, I just can't. In it's current state (end of 2021), the game is very unbalanced and not fun. It's very survivor sided and with things like boon totems and the power of med kits, the game just isn't fun as a killer.

great game, is good if you play against or using different killers as they all have different abilities and strategy needs to be adjusted depending on which killer you are facing. season events are good. have variety of skins and characters. survivors are fine but all of them are the same with different skin after you unlock all perks. maps are good but sometimes you might face bugs.
It's a game that really grows on you as you understand more of the nuance and gain skill. I found myself playing a lot more killer due to less wait time, but I have fun any time I play.

快600h，500h屠，70h人
我真的很喜欢这款游戏，但是国服已经不复存在了。就算现在的环境再烂我也会继续玩下去。
就算是现在击杀效率再高，带再多的控机技能，基本都是一挂一到两台。开局分修两挂就三台了，现在版本就不要带毁灭了。
锁机，心惊，天灾钩子，bbq
开局要做的第一件事情就是尽量掌握最多的信息，长图围绕哪一个半场打，哪边的资源交过了，哪边的地形能追。找节奏点打双针对。残局不要上头远离连机或电机，开局看情况带剁手，抱人想一下需不需要面壁，这一波挂地下室还是挂电机旁控机子。
开局没带封窗要提的门板，比如说死狗大房最起码要踢三个门板，小学的门要看情况踢。
虽然不存在输赢这一说法，但是你还是要结合屠夫特性去打，想的东西不是一句话能说的过来的。双窗LT白房套路学会了吗，甚至是轻刀还是蓄力刀。
因为车队的局是很紧凑的，你只要追错人，或者断了一波节奏，这一整局就没有了。
合理守尸，别无脑守。守尸是玩法，但一挂就守的，大家都没分，浪费大家时间，
最后屠夫都是需要训练时间的，从走低玩起再玩护士枯魔，慢慢感受这个游戏的魅力吧，至少现在杀鸡在我心中是同类型游戏比不下去的。
希望大家游戏开心。
I played it once without motion sickness. Now I'm addicted.
